name: Triangular Structure Visualizer
description:
The TSV is intended as a tool for FSU's Math researchers. More specifically, the TSV will be used to quickly whip up images of complex triangular structures in both Euclidean and non-Euclidean geometries.

The project will most likely be open source once finished for people to play around with and discover some of the beauty in triangular structures.

Note: Due to the limitations of 2D space, setting the angles to be higher than 90 will yield incorrect drawings.

CONTROLS:

Right click to pan the camera.

Mouse wheel to pan the camera.

ESC to quit the program.

This project was made as part of FSU's math research project, by:

Elias Diez, John Lazzari, Nicholas Fanguy.

Mentored by Dr. Alex Casella and Dr. Lorenzo Ruffoni.
